qas.question: Where are the large Martkirche located?
What is the old royal sports hall now called?
What is the name of the momument to the victims of war and violence?
What world famous landmark is located on the bank of the Leine?
Where does the Mile of Sculptures start?
What is located in the New Town center?
What is the old Ballhof theater called?
What church was built as a monument to victims of war and violence?
What starts at the Trammplatz and stops at the river bank?
What district is near the new town?

context: Another point of interest is the <a0_0>Old Town<a0_0/>. In the centre are <b5_0>the large Marktkirche<b5_0/> (Church St. Georgii et Jacobi, preaching venue of the bishop of the Lutheran Landeskirche Hannovers) and the Old Town Hall. Nearby are the Leibniz House, the Nolte House, and the Beguine Tower. A very nice quarter of the Old Town is the Kreuz-Church-Quarter around the Kreuz Church with many nice little lanes. Nearby is the old <b6_0>royal sports hall<b6_0/>, now called the <a1_0>Ballhof theatre<a1_0/>. On the edge of the Old Town are the Market Hall, the Leine Palace, and the ruin of the <a2_0><b7_0>Aegidien Church<b7_0/><a2_0/> which is now a monument to the victims of war and violence. Through the Marstall Gate you arrive at the bank of the river Leine, where the world-famous <a3_0>Nanas of Niki de Saint-Phalle<a3_0/> are located. They are part of <b8_0>the Mile of Sculptures<b8_0/>, which starts from <a4_0>Trammplatz<a4_0/>, leads along the river bank, crosses Königsworther Square, and ends at the entrance of the Georgengarten. Near the Old Town is the <b9_0>district of Calenberger Neustadt<b9_0/> where the Catholic Basilica Minor of St. Clemens, the Reformed Church and the Lutheran Neustädter Hof- und Stadtkirche St. Johannis are located.
